lexUnit.name: glow.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a steady radiance of light that illuminates an object

sentence.text: Somewhere out to sea the beam of the lighthouse appeared intermittently as a misty glow in the sky and the fog-horn was sounding .
The glow in his eyes made her heart swell , but she could n't resist a gentle tease .
It was still light and the orange glow in the western sky promised good weather for Sunday .
The only important thing , as far as she was concerned , was the gleaming silvery glow in his hooded grey eyes , and the warmth of the hard body pressed so closely to her own .
She would have experienced that glow of virtue which is so conducive to easy dieting .
It was not difficult to find their way , for the faint glow of the many camp-fires guided them and showed up the loom of the burgh 's buildings .
And as Brigitte Bardot has shown recently , even the glow of a new love affair can work wonders .
MASCOT : The badge that brings a glow of pride to Jag owners everywhere
The glow of the bonfire outlined her in gold .
Susan switched on the bedside lamp , a pink glow under its frilled shade , and reaching for her dressing-gown , shuffled sleepily to the bathroom next door , and then to the nursery .
She turned towards the dim glow of the fire in the grate .
Yes , there it was again , undoubtedly a dim glow of light in the two small windows of the oldest part of the Cathedral at two fifteen in the morning .
His shirt hung open as he sat again , and Theda 's eyes were riveted to the long column of his neck , the golden glow of his chest below it .
Well why not try Wolverhampton the golden glow of the amber shirts of Wolves will take on the proudly bar coded Magpies and would n't we like to see Notts wallop Wolves .
Inside all was dark except for the distant red glow of the sanctuary-lamp .
When she just kept on looking at him he threaded his hands in her hair and let it drift through his fingers , watching the deep red glow in the lights .
A warm glow of pride settled itself whenever she thought about it her own business ; she just wished her parents were still alive to witness it , and Mark , of course
By the time the last load was led , dusk was falling and the scene was lit from the west by the orange glow of the sunset .
In pursuance of this last , they waited until the first yells and screams sounded from the unhappy village , followed quickly by the glow of fire .
The streets were thronged all day with compulsive shoppers , intermittently spattered with hard-driven rain and tinted by the glow of festive lighting .
Eventually the light was left behind and they walked by the glow of the snow itself .
A free house with real ale where you can enjoy a meal in the glow of a roaring open fire .
Since they have visitors , Mrs Barton supplements it with a dip in a tin candlestick , although its light is lost in the glow of the fire , before pausing to look about her :
His face in the gloom outside the glow of light was pale beneath his smooth black hair , his eyes intent yet empty of expression .
We heard several loud explosions , then saw the enormous glow of fire . "
He was approaching the track leading to the bell tower , a dark grim silhouette in the moonlight , when he saw a great glow of light to his right in the distance .
As they neared the Workshops , Fenella heard the continuous thrumming of the Looms and saw the pulsating red glow of the furnaces .
It was then that she saw a soft glow of light in Helen 's bedroom .
I remember lying in bed and the only thing I could see was the dim glow of the light bulb on the ceiling .
Seeing the glow of a red and yellow Shell sign ahead , she drives on and pulls into the forecourt of a self-service petrol station .
Grimma could see the yellow-green glow in the fox 's eyes and the cloud of its breath .
With only the fire 's glow and the light from the lamp on the table remaining , he stretched out on the sofa , the tumbler between his hands bobbing gently on his domed belly .
I roll a joint and turn off the bright neon , leaving us with the sultry lilac glow of a smaller and older lamp , the first I ever bought .
But everything is warm and gilded with the last glow of the sunset , through the room 's west-facing windows .
